tool.name: spec2vec model training
tool.description: Train a Spec2Vec model for mass spectra similarity scoring

configfiles.configfile: python3 '${__tool_directory__}/spec2vec_training_wrapper.py' \ --spectra_filename '$spectra_filename' \ --spectra_fileformat '$spectra_filename.ext' \ #if $output_parameters.model_checkpoints.save_checkpoints == 'TRUE' --checkpoints '$output_parameters.model_checkpoints.checkpoints' \ #else --epochs $output_parameters.model_checkpoints.epochs \ #end if --vector_size $training_parameters.vector_size \ --alpha $training_parameters.alpha \ --min_alpha $training_parameters.min_alpha \ --window $training_parameters.window \ --min_count $training_parameters.min_count \ --sample $training_parameters.sample \ --seed $training_parameters.seed \ --sg $training_parameters.sg_param.sg \ #if not $training_parameters.sg_param.sg --cbow_mean $training_parameters.sg_param.cbow_mean \ #end if --hs $training_parameters.hs_param.hs \ #if not $training_parameters.hs_param.hs --negative $training_parameters.hs_param.negative \ --ns_exponent $training_parameters.hs_param.ns_exponent \ #end if --sorted_vocab $training_parameters.sorted_vocab \ --batch_words $training_parameters.batch_words \ --shrink_windows $training_parameters.shrink_windows \ #if $training_parameters.trim_vocab.max_vocab_size_bool == 'TRUE' --max_vocab_size $training_parameters.trim_vocab.max_vocab_size \ #end if --n_decimals $training_parameters.n_decimals \ --n_workers \${GALAXY_SLOTS:-1} \ #if $output_parameters.as_pickle --model_filename_pickle '$model_filename_pickle' \ #end if --model_filename '$model_filename' \ --weights_filename '$weights_filename' \

param.label: Training spectra
param.name: spectra_filename
param.help: Spectra file to train a Spec2Vec model.

param.label: Save model as Pickle file
param.name: as_pickle
param.help: Add a Pickle output besides default JSON.

param.label: Model checkpoints
param.name: save_checkpoints
param.help: Epochs after which to save a model.

param.label: Number of training epochs with checkpoints
param.name: checkpoints
param.help: Comma-separated epoch numbers after which to save a model. The highest number will be used as a total number of epochs for training.

validator.message: The input has to be a comma-separated sequence of integers without trailing commas. For example: 10,20,50

param.label: Number of training epochs
param.name: epochs
param.help: Number of epochs to train the model.

param.label: Vector size
param.name: vector_size
param.help: Dimensionality of the feature vectors (i.e., into how many dimensions to encode each m/z and neutral loss peak.

param.label: Alpha
param.name: alpha
param.help: The initial learning rate.

param.label: Minimum Alpha
param.name: min_alpha
param.help: Learning rate will linearly drop to this value as training progresses.

param.label: Window
param.name: window
param.help: Maximum distance between the current and predicted peak within a spectrum.

param.label: Minimum peak count
param.name: min_count
param.help: Ignores all peaks with absolute frequency lower than this.

param.label: Sample
param.name: sample
param.help: The threshold for configuring which higher-frequency peaks are randomly downsampled.

param.label: Seed
param.name: seed
param.help: Seed of random number generator for model reproducibility.

param.label: Word-Embedding type
param.name: sg
param.help: Embedding type: Skip-gram or Continuous Bag of Words

param.label: CBOW mean
param.name: cbow_mean
param.help: Whether to use the sum of the context word vectors or their mean.

param.label: Last Layer Activation
param.name: hs
param.help: Activation function of the last layer of the neural network. Negative sampling is more computationally efficient.

param.label: Negative Samples
param.name: negative
param.help: Specify how many 'negative' examples should be drawn for each peak and neutral loss (usually between 5-20).

validator.message: The value must be larger than 0.

param.label: Negative Sample Exponent
param.name: ns_exponent
param.help: The exponent used to shape the negative sampling distribution. A value of 1.0 samples exactly in proportion to the frequencies, 0.0 samples all peaks and neutral losses equally, while a negative value samples low-frequency peaks more often than high-requency peaks.

validator.message: The value must be within -1.0 and 1.0 range.

param.label: Sort the vocabulary of spectra
param.name: sorted_vocab
param.help: If true, sort the vocabulary by descending frequency before assigning peak and neutral loss indices.

param.label: Batch size
param.name: batch_words
param.help: Target size (in peaks and neutral losses) for batches of examples passed to worker threads (and thus cython routines). Larger batches will be passed if individual peak sequences are longer than 10000 words, but the standard cython code truncates to that maximum.

param.label: Shrink windows
param.name: shrink_windows
param.help: EXPERIMENTAL. If true, the effective window size is uniformly sampled in range [1,Window] for each target peak during training.

param.label: Limit unique peaks and neutral losses in the spectral vocabulary
param.name: max_vocab_size_bool
param.help: Limits the RAM during vocabulary building; if there are more unique peaks and neutral losses than this, then prune the infrequent ones. Disable for no limit (default).

param.label: Maximum unique peaks and neutral losses
param.name: max_vocab_size

param.label: Number of decimals to round m/z values
param.name: n_decimals
param.help: Rounds peak position to this number of decimals.

tool.help: **Spec2vec** is a spectral similarity score inspired by a natural language processing algorithm â€“ Word2Vec. Where Word2Vec learns relationships between words in sentences, spec2vec does so for mass fragments and neutral losses in MS/MS spectra. The spectral similarity score is based on spectral embeddings learnt from the fragmental relationships within a large set of spectral data.
